reviews.text: This is regarding Belair Beach Hotel.... I have been to St. Marteen many times because I have family there. Stayed at Belair.. I think it is a or should I say could be a great resort. Love the beach and the pool. I went Jet skiing and I thought that was a great experience, the guys that ran this program were great and one had a beautiful little baby.. I think the supermarket is a little expensive at the hotel, naturally you can find better prices if you go into town.. Very quiet. There is some problems at this resort...The elevators were having problems the entire 8 day stay. I was glad we were on the first floor(walking out to the beach) but we went to utilize the laundry room which is on the 4th floor, and had to climb the stairs back and forth. There was two black outs with no explanation. I would also like to add that the rooms are definately outdated and could use some Interior Decorating badly also the air conditioning was poor you don't get much cool air better to be outside by the water. They also need to upgrade the lounge chairs for the beach, and have some type of beach activities or music playing ,at least some of the time.. overall the staff is friendly
reviews.title: Needs Updating....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having just returned from a week at Belair, I must say kudos to Belair. Yes the second bedroom is small and the kitchen has 2 burners, a microwave, toaster oven and full refrig. But I did not go there to cook big meals. It worked fine for breakfast, and light lunches. The staff is what makes Belair a pleasure. Jody of Jody's Store was a delight. Once she asked your name, she called it anytime she saw you. (She is also an artist) Her shop was a real convenience. On arrival we were able to purchase enough essentials until we went to a larger super market. (The coconut sorbet is to die for) The Gingerbread House Cafe also was very convenient being on site. We ate 3 dinners there and one breakfast. They had live entertainment all 3 nights. Monday night was a pool side wine and cheese and then BBQ. Coming from BBQ country, I can say they did a bang up job. We did not rent a car. We found taxi's and local buses met our needs. Being right next door to Divi also gave us other lunch opportunities. Belair is not a "swanky" resort but is just "family". We were made welcome by all. We also were impressed with the "assigned" beach chairs. The attendant asked your room number then found convenient chairs and labeled them for the duration of your visit. Also provided and umbrella and towels, all at no charge. I understand that at many places you have to hurry down to nab a chair early in the day and pay a fee.. This eliminated that problem. We also had mid-week maid service and clean towels at no additional charge. We would definitely return to Belair. It just depends on your taste. It is not a big party resort, but is great for couples and families. Abuela 2
reviews.title: Loved Belair

reviews.text: We had the most relaxing week of our lives. We took the kids out of school on an off week from vacation. They had a blast even though there were no other kids around. We never got out of the clear blue water. The hotel is in the perfection location. Away from the hustle & bustle of town and on a beautiful, private beach. The view from every room is magnificent. We only left the property at night to eat in Maho. ("Pizza Pasta" restaurant is a must!!) The little mart on the property had alot of snacks, but a great supermarket is very close by. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. We felt safe. Our room was outdated and had a mildewy odor, however, the other rooms we went into did not. We stayed in it because we were on the 1st flr and literally 3 steps from the sand. I think they are changing the decor. The hotel itself was very clean. A negative remark would include: Possibly having waitress service on the beach for tropical drinks and adding some music for the vacation/tropical feel. It was a little too quiet at times. It is not a resort feel but we were looking for a rest. Definitely worth the stay. Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: very relaxing

likes.liked: — The room was 3 steps from beach, beautiful view, clean hotel, great sand/water, relaxing
likes.disliked: — our room was outdated and smelled of mildew

reviews.title: Looking forward to returning
reviews.text: When we first arrived we were somewhat concerned. It was late, the property was not as "resort" as we were accustomed to. By weeks end we were ready to return and stay for a month.

This is an "old school" property where every unit has a lovely view of one of the nicest beaches on the island. The units are kind of retro late 60's early 70's but VERY clean and well kept. The staff is friendly and helpful. Jody and her girls in the little store are wonderful and Rufus and staff at the Gingerbread Cafe are great.
reviews.title: Brilliant relaxed holiday

reviews.text: We have just returned from St Maarten and stayed in three resorts during our time there. The Belair was definately the best of all three. We could not have asked for anything more. The customer service was excellent. The security around the resort gave a very safe and secure feeling. All the staff and I do mean all the staff were fun, friendly and very welcoming. The best thing about this resort is the setting...every room faces the ocean and has huge sliding doors that open right up so it feels like there is nothing between you and the beautiful veiw. The rooms are clean and even if they need a bit of an update in the second bathrooms it was just right for us. We had our 6 year old granddaugther with us and the pool, while not large was just enough for her when she needed a change from the ocean. The waves may have been a bit large at first but we soon realized that it just depends on the weather and every day we were able to swim safely right infront of our room. The staff on the beach would have our towels, umbrella and chairs ready for us everyday. The Gingerbread cafe had resonabley priced and tasty meals when we did not want to leave the resort or cook for ourselves. The laundry room was clean and easy to use, never had to wait for the machines. The resort is nicely situated between Philipburg and Simpsons Bay so it was very easy to get anywhere on the island. We would definately go back to the Belair. It was awesome and we would recomend a visit to this resort .
reviews.title: This resort is perfect.

likes.liked: — Setting of the rooms , the beach and the location on the island.
likes.disliked: — The second bedroom was a bit small and the second bathroom needed and update.

reviews.title: Great Stay!
reviews.text: Just got back from a six day stay at the Belair Beach Hotel and I have zero complaints! I was immediately impressed by the friendliness of all the staff there. They were more than accommodating and helped us with whatever we needed. The hotel itself is located on a beautiful beach that is shared by only one other property which makes it very nice and peaceful. Its location is about a 5 minute cab ride away from Philipsburg in one direction and the Simpson Bay area in the other. I found the location perfect because the hotel was in a nice, quiet area but we were still so close to many of the activities that we wanted to do.

reviews.title: Very nice if you know what to expect!
reviews.text: I agree with some of the previous reviews - the hotel probably could use a few updates, but it is by no means dirty or falling apart. The bed was comfortable, the shower was clean, the kitchen had everything you could need. The best part of the room was the view. Every room has a long balcony with a beautiful view of the Caribbean Sea.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't find renting a car necessary for the entire week, but I did rent a car through the service at the hotel for one day which was easy and fairly inexpensive (about $50 for the day which is less than it would've cost to take a cab all the way to the other side of the island and back). Otherwise, taxis are always available and reasonably priced as well.
reviews.title: Great Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lorna at the activities desk was also very helpful. We were able to book a few activities through her and she also gave us great tips on places to eat and a few coupons as well.
reviews.title: Wonderful relaxing vacation

likes.liked: — Location to the beach, very close

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel. It is right on the beach, which we loved. The 2 bedrooms were perfect for me, my husband, our 10 month old daughter and my mother-in-law. It was clean and the staff was great! Very friendly. I am glad that I read reviews and saw that it was old and some of the air conditioning units leaked. We were prepared for a pretty bad room, so we were happily surprised to have a clean place. This is a nice place to stay. Not 5 stars by any means, but it was still nice.
reviews.title: Good and clean hotel
Perfect if you like the beach at your door
reviews.text: We traded in our Cabo timeshare for a week in August at the Belair. Our family of four loved it. We asked for a 1st floor unit, so only walked a few steps to the beach. "Jody's Place" the tiny store in the hotel had 50 cent beer specials everyday and we used our kitchen for most dinners.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second bedroom is small with only a double bed, but was fine for our two teenage daughters. If you prefer the sound of the ocean waves over the sound of loud music and bingo, this small resort is great. The pool is tiny, but we only used it to rinse off our salt, so didn't mind.
reviews.title: loved the beach and the atmoshere

reviews.text: The snorkeling is better than the activities director would have you believe. There isn't any coral, but we saw a large variety of fish while snorkeling in the bay.
reviews.title: Funky, laid back, great view, you will need a rental car

likes.liked: — Beautiful views, very casual, central location for beach hopping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We toured the Pelican Resort on St. Maartin to compare it to the Belair. I was very pleased with our choice of the smaller hotel, but if you are a big people watcher and want more activities you might prefer a larger resort.
reviews.title: Not too impressed...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one week at the Belair Resort at Little Bay in St. Maarten. This was our first trip there and was, for the most part, very enjoyable. The resort is small with one of the best beaches that I have been on. There is an on-site restaurant, activities desk, laundry, pool, water sports, car rental, and convenience store.
reviews.title: Belair Little Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All units are beach front. Our unit was a 2-bedroom apartment with a large terrace. The larger bedroom had a king-size bed, television, and the bathroom had two sinks and a tub. Water pressure was very good. The second bedroom was very small with no tv and had a bathroom/shower that also opened into the hallway. The windows of both bedrooms overlooked the parking lot.
reviews.title: Five Days in Paradise

likes.liked: — Location right on the water staff

reviews.text: The kitchen was small with no dishwasher, but it had a two-burner stove, nice refrigerator, and was kept very clean by the staff. Living room had a television, two sofas, coffee table, ceiling fan; dining area had a nice table and chairs to seat 4 and two stools for the counter. The air conditioning unit had some sort of card that fit into it once you selected the temperature. I had never seen anything like it, but it worked.
reviews.title: Bad Staff Attitude at Belair

reviews.text: Had both breakfast and lunch in the Gingerbread Cafe and meals were very good. There is some type of theme dinner every night and the prices are reasonable.
reviews.title: Great Beach Hotel

likes.disliked: — Unit needed some upkeep (some lights didn't work well)

reviews.text: Booked a massage through the Activity Desk. Tara is the masseuse affiliated with Belair, and she is excellent. However, it is very important to specify which type of massage you want. I was not asked by Lorna, the activities director, and she selected the massage for me. That was corrected when I met with Tara. You must pay Lorna for the massage when booking and it must be in cash. Since Tara doesn't bring towels or sheets with her, you will need to get three towels from the towel attendants from the beach. They are not happy to give them out.
reviews.title: Relaxing Vacation

likes.disliked: — air conditioning was very cold and couldn't be adjusted.
